title: Snow Covers Portions of North Dakota Amid Blizzard Warning
text:
Some residents in North Dakota woke up to more than a dozen inches of snow on Friday, October 11, the National Weather Service (NWS) said.

Several cities in northern North Dakota were put under a blizzard warning until midday Saturday. The storm could bring 60 mph winds and additional snowfall between nine and 18 inches.

The NWS recorded 13.2 inches of snow at the Bismarck Airport. This video shows snow piled up outside a Bismarck home.

A winter storm warning was issued by the NWS for Bismarck and surrounding cities. The NWS said travel could be “very difficult” due to reduced visibility from snowy conditions. Credit: Blakeley Kantor via Storyful
